seamonsters.joystick¶

class seamonsters.joystick.DynamicAxis(exponent=1.0, speedScaleFactor=0.0, speedScaleExponent=0.0, deadZone=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(exponent=1.0, speedScaleFactor=0.0, speedScaleExponent=0.0, deadZone=None)[source]¶

exponent should be >= 1. speedScaleFactor should be >= 1. speedScaleExponent should be <= 1 (use 0 to ignore speed). deadZone should be < 1 and close to 0.

update(value)[source]¶
class seamonsters.joystick.JoystickBase(port)[source]¶

Bases: wpilib.joystick.Joystick

The base for other joystick utilities classes. This has methods for checking whether buttons have been pressed or released.

__init__(port)[source]¶
buttonPressed(b)[source]¶

Check if the specified button was pressed between the most recent updateButtons() call and the call before that.

buttonReleased(b)[source]¶

Check if the specified button was released between the most recent updateButtons() call and the call before that.

getJoystickButton(buttonNumber)[source]¶
updateButtons()[source]¶

Update the current state of the buttons. Call this in the main loop.

class seamonsters.joystick.JoystickUtils(port)[source]¶

Bases: seamonsters.joystick.JoystickBase

An extended Joystick with extra utilities for deadzones and a new definition of direction: positive X is now zero, which is more standard.

__init__(port)[source]¶
getDirection()[source]¶

Get the direction of the joystick. wpilib.Joystick’s built-in getDirection() says 0 is positive y. This version uses positive x.

getMagnitude(enableDeadZone=True)[source]¶

Get the magnitude of the joystick. The dead zone is enabled by default; set enableDeadZone to False to disable it.

getRawMagnitude()[source]¶
getRawTwist()[source]¶
getRawX()[source]¶
getRawY()[source]¶
getRawZ()[source]¶
getTwist(enableDeadZone=True)[source]¶

Get the twist of the joystick. The dead zone is enabled by default; set enableDeadZone to False to disable it.

getX(enableDeadZone=True)[source]¶

Get the value of the x-axis. The dead zone is enabled by default; set enableDeadZone to False to disable it.

getY(enableDeadZone=True)[source]¶

Get the value of the y-axis. The dead zone is enabled by default; set enableDeadZone to False to disable it.

getZ(enableDeadZone=True)[source]¶

Get the value of the z-axis. The dead zone is enabled by default; set enableDeadZone to False to disable it.

invertX(enabled=True)[source]¶

Choose whether to invert the value of the x axis.

invertY(enabled=True)[source]¶

Choose whether to invert the value of the y axis.

positionInDeadZone()[source]¶

Check if the position of the joystick is currently in the deadzone. Return a boolean value.

setPositionDeadZone(value)[source]¶

Set the deadzone of the position of the joystick, on a scale of 0 to 1. If the magnitude is within this range it will be reported as 0. Default value is 0.05 (5 percent).

setTwistDeadZone(value)[source]¶

Set the deadzone of the twist of the joystick, on a scale of 0 to 1. If the twist is within this range it will be reported as 0. Default value is 0.1 (10 percent).

setZDeadZone(value)[source]¶

Set the deadzone of the z-axis of the joystick, on a scale of 0 to 1. If the value is within this range it will be reported as 0. Default value is 0.1 (10 percent).

twistInDeadZone()[source]¶

Check if the twist of the joystick is currently in the deadzone. Return a boolean value.

zInDeadZone()[source]¶

Check if the z-axis of the joystick is currently in the deadzone. Return a boolean value.
